meanings.definition: a person who has seen something happen and can give a first-hand account of it
meanings.sent1: The eyewitness described the car accident to the police.
meanings.sent2: The eyewitness was called to testify in court.
meanings.sent3: The eyewitness couldn't stop talking about what they saw.
meanings.sent4: Being an eyewitness to history is a privilege.
meanings.sent5: The eyewitness's testimony was crucial for solving the case.

meanings.definition: to see something happen and be able to give a first-hand account of it
meanings.sent1: I eyewitnessed the whole incident from my window.
meanings.sent2: She eyewitnesses every event with great attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: We eyewitnessed the squirrel stealing nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: He eyewitnessed the sunrise over the mountains.
meanings.sent5: Eyewitnessing the crime made her feel anxious.
